attributes.action: Stop Go Ape from spoiling our Free Green Space at Roundhay Park in Leeds.
attributes.additional_details: Go Ape are wanting to use a large part of the park. Cutting of access to certain parts of the park to paying customers surely detracts from the parks appeal of being an unspoiled, free green place for everyone.
attributes.background: Roundhay Park is a local public park. It is one of the most beautiful parks in Leeds and is used by not just local people but people who travel to visit. Families, runners and dog walkers all use this beautiful green space.

rejection.details:
Parks are the responsibility of your local council. You could try contacting your local councillor with your concern. You can find their contact details here: http://democracy.leeds.gov.uk/mgMemberIndex.aspx?bcr=1

You could also contribute to the council's consultation about the Go Ape proposal here: http://www.leeds.gov.uk/leisure/Pages/Roundhay-Park.aspx
